media.caption: Joint Articel Niras+RDFox

text.headline: Article: Data-driven Construction Planning with Knowledge Graphs and Reasoning
text.text: Using Linked Data and incremental reasoning, construction planning suddenly becomes parametric because the construction schedule is directly linked to the building models. As we change data in the models, the schedule changes accordingly. This enables us to explore alternatives and to see the impact of doing things differently.

Workshop at Bilt Europe 2022 in Valencia to teach Linked Building Data (LBD)

media.caption: VDC for everyone

text.headline: BIM Island Conference
text.text: Showcase of the VDC implementation on site at the project NY Ellebjerg in Copenhagen. The focus was set on teaching how all project participants and especially the workers on site can benefit from VDC.

text.headline: Per Aarsleff A/S
text.text:
VDC Coordinator & Developer

  • Implementing and Executing VDC services at the construction project Ny Ellebjerg Concourse Hall.
  • Developinig new solutions and more automated processes within VDC and digitalization.
  • Actively driving innovation projects for our VDC department.

media.caption: 4D Web Simulation for the project CRSH6

text.headline: IfcSim: Development of a web-based 4D simulation of the main schedule
text.text:
Out of the challenge on site that our 4D simulation video - created in Navisworks - was not interactive and therefore not used on site

The web-based simulation was accessible by everyone through the browser, interactive as with a 3D-viewer and easy to update with changes in the models or the schedule

• Constructability

  • Technical design for fabrication

media.caption: BIM Kiosk implementation on site

text.headline: BIM Kiosk
text.text:
VDC for all - how to bring VDC to the construction site

Construction endurable computer on site with internet connection that enables access to the project material and to all VDC services for every project participant. Especially our concrete workers actively used this service to coordinate the construction sequences for the reinforcement design and to access the related drawings.

The BIM Kiosk allowed to access all of these services through the web:

  • ACC project platform
  • Trimble Connect model developemnt and design changes
  • Trimble Connect model coordination and construction sequences
  • Web-based 4D
  • Web-based Site model
  • Web-based point-cloud and as-built review

media.caption: Digital modelling of a noise screen project

text.headline: Noise Screen Project
text.text:
Pilot project to test the potential of using VDC for general rail (linear) projects

The project included the following steps:

  • Modelling of noise screen piles based on coordinates, rotation and profile information via Grasshopper
  • Dividing the project stretch into zones where specific principles are applied
  • Generating excavation surfaces based on the profile zoning and a point cloud for the existing terrain
  • Generating quantity reports for the excavations
  • Visual quality assurance of the project in 3D
  • Export of LandXML files to automate the excavation process
